title: 112_hr4623
content: Exemption for certain dividends paid by regulated investment companies to nonresident aliens expanded and made permanent. Exemptions for certain dividends paid by regulated investment companies to nonresident aliens expanded and made permanent by amending sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 expand and make permanent exemptions for certain dividends paid by regulated investment companies to nonresident aliens. These exemptions include interest exempt from tax under section 103, income determined by reference to an interest rate not subject to withholding under section 1441, income from foreign sources, and qualified income-related dividends from another regulated investment company. The amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 expand exemptions for dividends paid by regulated investment companies to nonresident aliens. This includes interest exempt from tax under section 103, income from foreign sources, and qualified income-related dividends. Amendments also modify exceptions related to interest and income terminology within the code. The amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 expand exemptions for dividends paid by regulated investment companies to nonresident aliens, including interest exempt from tax under section 103, income from foreign sources, and qualified income-related dividends. The modifications also involve changing terminology related to interest and income within the code. The amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 involve changing terminology related to interest and income, such as replacing "Qualified interest income" with "Qualified income" and "interest-related dividend" with "qualified income-related dividend." The amendments involve changing terminology related to interest and income in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, such as replacing "interest-related dividend" with "qualified income-related dividend." Effective after December 31, 2011.
